title: Systems Analyst (Remote)
description:
Conexess Group is aiding a large healthcare client in their search for Systems Analyst in a remote capacity. This is a long-term opportunity with a competitive compensation package.

Please note we are unable to provide sponsorship or work c2c for this role.

Responsibilities:
• Provides counsel and advice to top management on significant Systems Analysis matters, often requiring coordination between organizations.
• Under general direction, works on extremely complex issues/problems or assignments of large scope, impact, and importance.
• Gather, analyze, document, and validate systems by conducting interviews, observation sessions, and workflow process analysis
• Analyzes, designs and prepares technical and procedural documentation on complex concepts and issues related to applications, interfaces, data structures and workflows across the organization (e.g. batch processing documentation, data flows, architectural diagrams, runbooks, etc)
• Support internal and external audit needs including the procurement or authoring artifacts or documents related to the implementation and operational support of an application or system
• Coordinates the activities with other IT sections (e.g., data base, telecommunications, operations, technical support, etc.) on application or system changes.
• Support application development teams for technology release events, prior/during/post deployment
• May work with business partners to identify and specify the complex business requirements and processes, and in the application design, testing and implementation process (e.g., diverse development platforms, software, hardware, technologies and tools, etc.).
• Has full technical knowledge of all phases of applications systems analysis.

Requirements:
• Bachelor degree in relevant field
• 5+ years in a systems analysis role or similar capacity
• 5+ years of hands-on software troubleshooting experience
• Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with business and technology teams
• Strong detailed analytical skills
• Takes initiative and is a self-starter
• Ability to stay very organized while managing multiple tasks and activities
• Ability to seamlessly ‘switch channels’ and prioritize competing requests and deliverables
• Team player with proven ability to foster and manage working relationships within a matrix environment
• Dealing with ambiguity and problem solving
• Proficient in MS Office tools (Word, Excel, Visio, Outlook)
• 7-10 years in Information Technology within a large matrixed organization

Desired Experience / Qualifications:
• Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related discipline preferred
• Waterfall and Agile Experience
• Experience with tools such as Clarity, Webex, JIRA, Service Now, Confluence, Sharepoint
• Experience with developing or implementing enterprise technology solutions including applications, servers, network infrastructure
• Experience supporting IT solutions or projects related to Utilization Management, Care Management or Clinical Data Initiatives
• Healthcare experience

title: Financial Business Analyst
description:
Alamo Group Inc. is currently accepting applications to fill the position of Financial Business Analyst at its Corporate Headquarters in Seguin, TX (25 miles east of San Antonio, TX).

Why Alamo Group?

Founded in 1969, with its Corporate Headquarters in Seguin, TX, and 32 manufacturing locations in the U.S., Canada, England, France, The Netherlands, Australia, and Brazil, Alamo Group Inc. has been a leader in the design, manufacture, distribution, and service of high quality equipment for infrastructure maintenance, agriculture, and other applications. Seguin is located in South Central Texas along the Guadalupe River, a short distance from San Antonio, TX (25 miles), Austin, TX (50 miles), and many other small/mid-sized cities that offer a unique blend of cultural, entertainment, educational, and recreational activities.

Alamo Group offers competitive pay and a wide range of employee benefits including:
? Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage (on the 1st day of employment)
? 401(k) Retirement Savings Program with a Company Match (on the 1st day of employment)
? Profit Sharing
? Paid Vacation, Sick Leave, and Holidays
? Company Paid Short and Long-Term Disability Programs
? Wellness Programs
? Employee Assistance Programs
? Training and Development Programs
? Employee Tuition Reimbursement and Dependent Scholarship Programs
? And much more!

For more information about Alamo Group, go to www.alamo-group.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

Alamo Group Inc. is currently accepting applications to fill the position of Financial Business Analyst at its Corporate Headquarters in Seguin, TX (25 miles east of San Antonio, TX).

Under direction, the Financial Business Analyst assists the Director of Financial Systems in supporting and maintaining the Company?s financial enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, custom financial applications, data conversion, reporting and ERP implementations. The Financial Business Analyst develops and deploys information tools to drive continuous improvement within the accounting function of Alamo Group Inc. Liaise with other corporate departments and manufacturing facilities to facilitate the development of new reports, procedures and policies related to accounting operations. Performs financial reporting analysis and assists with financial month end, quarter, and annual close to provide accurate financial information for the Company.

The Financial Business Analyst Will
? Analyze Alamo Group financial and accounting functions, processes, and activities to ensure the effectiveness and efficiency of accounting ERP applications.
? Monitor, analyze and resolve ERP system error messages to ensure the integrity of financial reports and other reporting mechanisms.
? Consult with manufacturing facilities on areas of concern and/or areas targeted for change/improvement.
? Provide financial system training on new procedures and implementations.
? Assist with the conversion and implementation of new acquisitions onto the ERP system.
? Liaise with IT programmers, developers and other key business representatives on the testing and implementation of software enhancements and upgrades.
? Prepare reconciliations of various general ledger accounts for multiple facilities.
? Assist with financial month, quarter, and year end close; includes developing and running reports and preparing/entering journal entries.
? Extract, apply and analyze information and data through available tools and integrated financial ERP systems (i.e., JD Edwards) for the department, and assist the manufacturing facility accounting representatives with the extraction and analysis of critical business/financial information.
? Stays abreast of IT and business/accounting intelligence tools available in the market and keeps management informed of their capabilities and functionality; recommends acquisition and/or implementation of tools that will assist in leveraging the corporate investment in JDE.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have/be
? Knowledge of economic and general accounting principles and practices (GAAP, etc.)
? Knowledge of business, financial and accounting principles involved in examining, verifying, and analyzing financial reports, statements, and general ledger best practices.
? Knowledge of general laws, government regulations and agency rules that pertain to a publically traded manufacturing operation.
? Knowledge of business intelligence data mining tools and processes.
? Working knowledge of today?s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and financial analysis software; previous experience with JD Edwards is preferred.
? Highly skilled and proficient with the use of personal computers; including complex financial spreadsheet analysis, Microsoft Excel Dashboards, Microsoft Word, and other mainstream office software.
? Ability to identify, compile, analyze and evaluate complex financial and technical data, review related information, and apply innovative thinking to develop, evaluate and make sound recommendations.
? Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with the ability to formulate and deliver relevant financial reporting and material in a clear and concise manner that appeals to all levels of the organization.
? Ability to build and foster effective business relationships with customers and other departments within the organization.
? Ability to quickly learn new software and apply it to special projects.
? Demonstrated ability to provide timely, detailed, results oriented reporting.
? Ability to work irregular and/or long hours that may include weekends and/or holidays as financial reporting schedules dictate.
? Demonstrated ability to exhibit and model Alamo Group?s Core Competencies:
? Leading Change/Change Management: Ability to drive improvement of team, division, and corporate goals and objectives through people. Ability to balance change and continually strive to improve business performance.
? Leading People/Teamwork: The ability to design and implement strategies that maximize employees? potential and foster high ethical standards in meeting the team, division, and corporate objectives.
? Communication: The ability to explain, advocate, and express facts and ideas in a convincing manner, and negotiate with individuals and groups, both internally and externally. The ability to develop internal and external networks and identify issues that impact the work of the organization.
? Business Acumen: Understands and interprets business financials and metrics and utilizes latest business strategies. Focuses on outcomes and creates opportunities for success. Acquires and utilizes human, financial, material, and information resources effectively.
? Results Driven/Process: The ability to make timely and effective decisions and produce results through planning and the implementation and the evaluation of business processes, metrics, systems, policies, and programs; stressing accountability and continuous improvement.

Education And Experience
? Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, business administration or related field is required.
? 3-5 years of progressive experience supporting business or financial operations; preferably in a multi-facility manufacturing environment.
? Experience with Reports Now or other report writing software is desirable.

Working Conditions

Primarily in an office environment indoors with frequent sitting for extended periods of time. Occasional lifting, pushing, or pulling of 10 pounds in the performance of financial and administrative responsibilities.

Occasional travel, both domestic and international may be required to support training and implementation requirements associated with the financial EPR system.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Senior Application Analyst (Patient Access)
description:
Location Details: Remote must be a Texas resident

Job Description
• Will support the client s Primary Care clinics across the region with build-out and maintenance of Epic applications. Responsible for identifying, evaluating, analyzing, and recommending changes in support of assigned applications / systems, including ongoing production maintenance and troubleshooting.
• Supports the planning, design, development, build and/or configuration of supported applications / systems; leads and/or coordinates conversions, application / system testing and documentation of system procedures; participates and provides input in training design and development and assists in training execution related to assigned projects; provides go-live support, and serves as primary point of contact for on-going production maintenance/support and troubleshooting.
• Participates in on-call / afterhours support schedule as defined within the Group. Serves as Lead or Project Manager for medium to large sized projects.

Responsibilities
• Implementation: Responsibility for evaluating project requests associated with field of expertise and/or systems supported, conducting current state assessments, requirements gathering and definition, future state design and application build activities.
• Responsible for leading implementation teams in planning, design, development, testing (unit, application and integrated), and deployment of projects, as well as contributing to development of associated training curriculum/program, post implementation documentation and production support services.
• Ensure systems design supports corporate policies and federal legislation, where applicable. Work with customer departments to ensure solutions to complex business issues are an appropriate fit organization wide.
• Project Management: Prepare detailed project plans. Lead Application Team in adhering to project schedules and timelines and completing projects on time and within budget. Identify and escalate issues to appropriate sponsor group, steering committee or other governing body to ensure successful implementation (on time, on budget and within scope). Responsible for facilitating change request process in relation to assigned projects. Prepare supporting documentation and present initial project requests and change requests to appropriate Change Advisory Subgroup(s). Provide weekly status updates on assigned projects. Work with manager to coordinate necessary support with Project Management Office (PMO) as needed.
• Maintenance, Support and Troubleshooting: Monitor, acknowledge and resolve ServiceNow tickets as assigned. Coordinate software and hardware patches, service packs, and version upgrades with customer departments and System Administrator(s). Develop and maintain documentation for system procedures.
• Administrative: Log hours for project-related work in the Project Portfolio Management (ServiceNow) system on a weekly basis. Utilize ALM Quality Center system for creating test cases and scripts, monitoring testing execution and providing documentation as required for production change control approval. Attend General Information Services (GIS) meetings, weekly Business Application Services team meetings, application team meetings as appropriate, and other meetings as needed.
• Production Support and Maintenance: On call support (support calendar defined by Group or application suite, pager required); Ensuring the integrity, integration and stability of production system; Formulating system scope and objectives to develop or modify complex system designs; Daily checklist for servers, services, log files, backups, scheduled SQL jobs, scheduled tasks, CPU usage, monitor space, transaction logs etc.; Interface maintenance and support; Ensure coordination and documentation of hardware and software support and upgrades (servers, SQL, Citrix servers, VM Ware, desktop, network, telecommunication, SAN storage, internet application, remote users); Working closely with IT resources during upgrades and issue resolutions; Troubleshoot application, process and technical issues. Identify required resources and coordinate all efforts until issue is resolved. Complete documentation as needed; Coordinate and complete tasks during unplanned downtimes including system maintenance; Support training of IS staff and end-users as needed; Direct and coordinate communication, including notification to application teams and departmental super-users and key stakeholders of scheduled and unscheduled downtimes, vendor communication, and staff communication; Daily communication with key business process owners and departmental system support staff; Explaining technical and software concepts to non-IS staff; Stay current with new application functionality and enhancements; Consult vendor support sites, discussion forums, and other sources to identify leading practices for problem resolution; Utilize vendor support site to log issues for assistance in resolution; Coordinate with Group Manger and System Administrators and customer departments to implement recommended solutions; and Other duties as assigned.

Work Experience
• At least 4 years of work-related experience required
• Project management experience required
• Direct experience related to same or similar systems installed required

EDUCATION
• Four-year bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required
• Enterprise App Analysts supporting software must demonstrate competency in software used in their role. All training and testing applicable to the role must be successfully completed and passed within 90 days of employment. Continuing education requirements must be completed and maintained for applications applicable to the role required
• If an internal candidate, 4 years of direct application experience overrides the need for a bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required

CERTIFICATION
• Epic Prelude, Grand Central, Cadence, Referral, Welcome
• Preferred:  RTE certification preferred.
• STRONGLY PREFERRED: primarily FT background rather than consultant.

title: EDI File Business Analyst – Trustmark Companies – Colorado – Chicago, IL
description:
Job title: EDI File Business Analyst

Company: Trustmark Companies

Job description: Join a passionate and purpose-driven team of colleagues who contribute to Trustmark’s mission of helping people increase wellbeing through better health and greater financial security. At Trustmark, you’ll work collaboratively to transform lives and help people, communities and businesses thrive. Flourish in a culture of diversity and inclusion where appreciation, mutual respect and trust are constants, not just for our customers but for ourselves. At Trustmark, we have a commitment to welcoming people, no matter their background, identity or experience, to a workplace where they feel safe being their whole, authentic selves. A workplace made up of diverse, empowered individuals that allows ideas to thrive and enables us to bring the best to our colleagues, clients and communities.

As one of the nation’s largest independent benefits administrators, Trustmark Health Benefits helps our clients manage costs without compromising care by offering innovative solutions, flexibility and complete data transparency for our clients. Our responsive and empathetic customer service teams provide the highest level of support for employers and members.

The Outbound File Technical Analyst is the SME (subject matter expert) for hundreds of outbound files in many different file layouts and formats for our client’s vendors and works directly with programmers for new file builds and changes to existing files. This position involves analyzing a vendor file layout(s) and the needs of the particular vendor, writing business requirements, meeting with vendors and programmers to ensure understanding, creating test plans and testing scenarios, documenting testing results and collaborating with programmers to achieve the end result and finally providing user sign off for deployment of files to production. This position requires analytical and critical thinking skills to ensure that programming is accurate based on the needs of a client’s vendor. In addition this position works with team members and other internal customers and external customers by analyzing a question or issue to either provide an explanation or determine if programming changes are needed and work with programmers to implement a change when needed. Problem solving and sound decision making skills are needed.

Job Responsibilities include:
• Understand the overall purpose of why a vendor needs a particular file(s)
• Analyze a vendor file layout(s) field by field
• Meet with vendor and/or client to obtain additional information when needs are unclear
• Facilitate ongoing communication with vendor and/or client
• Write detailed business requirements
• Meet with programmers to ensure understanding of needs for each field on a file layout
• Create test plans for a specific file(s) based on client and vendor criteria
• Create testing scenarios in the test region
• Perform review of test files field by field and document testing results. The review and testing cycle may occur multiple times. Collaborate with programmers on solutions to achieve the end result needed.
• Track progress and ensure due dates are met
• Provide final user sign off after all requirements have been met so programming can be deployed to the production environment
• Review and audit 1st production files to ensure production turnover accuracy
• Work collaboratively with team members, other internal departments and external customers to analyze and research a question, determine a solution and provide an explanation or request programming changes when necessary.
• Other duties as needed/assigned

Job Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in business or equivalent experience
• Minimum of 4 years prior experience working in the insurance or TPA industry in a technical role working with EDI files and/or analyzing and testing electronic data files
• Understanding of EDI terminology and file structures
• Ability to read, understand and interpret file specifications
• Experience with SQL and compare tools like UltraEdit
• Proven problem solving, troubleshooting and analytical skills are essential
• Ability to determine solutions and resolve issues with minimal supervision
• Ability to work collaboratively with team members and other internal departments as well as external vendors
• Excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize workload in a frequently interrupted environment
• Proficient with Excel and Word
• Strong written, verbal, collaboration and interpersonal communication skills
• Sound decision making skills
• Customer service focused.

Come join Trustmark! Join a team that will not only utilize your current skills but will enhance them as well. Trustmark benefits include health/dental/vision, life insurance, FSA and HSA, 401(k) plan, Employee Assistant Program, Back-up Care for Children, Adults and Elders and many health and wellness initiatives. We also offer a Wellness program that enables employees to participate in health initiatives to reduce their insurance premiums.

For the second consecutive year we were selected as a Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune. The award is based exclusively on Trustmark associate responses to an anonymous survey. The survey measured 15 key drivers of engaged cultures that are critical to the success of an organization.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, sexual identity, age, veteran or disability.

If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.

Expected salary:

Location: Colorado - Chicago, IL

Job date: Thu, 08 Sep 2022 05:14:35 GMT

Apply for the job now!

title: Oracle Utilities CC&B Analyst
description:
About Us

We are a leading boutique consulting firm trusted by Fortune 500 companies to deliver transformative results on complex, high-impact projects. From strategy to execution, our work on project management, software testing and AI-powered test automation helps global organizations navigate disruption, unlock growth, boost efficiency and reduce costs.

The Role

We are seeking an experienced Oracle Utility CC&B Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting large-sclae utility transformation projects. You will play a key role in the analysis, design, configuration, testing, and implementation of Oracle Utilities Customer Care and Billing (CC&B) solutions. You will collaborate with business and technical teams to understand requirements, identify gaps, and help deliver effective solutions to support business processes. This position is perfect for someone who is a team player, a quick learner, and can adapt to working with our client, a Fortune 500 company, on large projects involving both onshore and offshore teams.

Key Responsibilities
• Lead and deliver end-to-end engagements with Fortune 500 clients
• Work closely with business users to gather and analyze CC&B requirements
• Design functional solutions within the CC&B application to meet client needs
• Configure CC&B modules including Customer Information, Billing, Payments, Credit & Collections, and Meter Management
• Develop and execute test plans and support UAT (User Acceptance Testing)
• Provide production support, troubleshoot issues, and recommend improvements
• Create functional documentation, user guides, and training materials as needed
• Define project scope, objectives, timelines, and success metrics
• Consistently achieve daily and weekly objectives, demonstrating reliability and commitment to performance standards
• Mentor team members and support talent development
• Occasional travel is required

Qualifications
• 3+ years of hands-on experience with Oracle CC&B (Customer Care & Billing)
• Strong understanding of utility business processes (customer service, billing, metering, collections)
• Experience with other Oracle Utilities products (e.g., MDM, C2M, WAM) is a plus
• Experience with configuration, functional testing, and solution design in CC&B
• Ability to translate business requirements into functional specifications
• Understanding of different testing environments
• Familiarity with Agile methodology, with a focus on User Acceptance Testing processes, including involvement in sprint reviews, user story validation, and collaboration with stakeholders to ensure that deliverables meet user requirements
• Knowledge of Azure DevOps (ADO), Jira, ALM or similar tools, including test case execution, user stories, and bug tracking
• Prior consulting experience with large utility projects
• Experience working in a remote setting
• Must be authorized to work in the US without restrictions

Education:
• Bachelor's Degree / In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in IT or related field
• Oracle CC&B Certification is a plus

Why Join Us?
• High-impact work with world-class clients
• Great company culture
• Career progression and leadership opportunities
• Support for continuous learning and innovation
• A workplace that values diversity, equity, and inclusion

Salary Starts At: $120,000 base + generous performance bonus for W2 employees or starts at $65 / hour for 1099 contractors.

Benefits: Healthcare, 401(k) with match, generous PTO, parental leave, professional development budget.

Compensation at zSky varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific location, role, skill set, level of experience and education.

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity. We base our employment decisions on merit, experience, and potential, without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local law.

title: Senior Conflicts Analyst ll l Multiple Locations
description:
Who We Are

FTI Consulting is the world's leading expert-driven consulting firm. Over the last 40 years, FTI Consulting experts have served as the trusted advisor to Fortune 500 companies and the world's leading law and private equity firms when they are facing their greatest opportunities and challenges. Our strong performance and continued success are a direct reflection of the ambition, energy, and commitment of our talented professionals across the globe to make a positive impact for our clients and communities.

At FTI Consulting, you'll be inspired and empowered to make an impact on headline matters that change history. Working side by side with the world's leading experts in your field, you'll be surrounded by an open collaborative culture that embraces diversity, recognition, professional development and most importantly, you.

There's never been a more exciting time to join FTI Consulting and this is where you will do the most exciting and fulfilling work of your career.

Are you ready to make an impact?

About The Role

The Senior Conflicts Analyst II applies advanced knowledge of conflicts principles to clearance checks with minimal supervision. Strong communication skills are key, as the role involves gathering and clarifying sensitive legal and business information from professionals at all levels. The Analyst must adapt quickly, manage high-volume matters under pressure, and maintain confidentiality. The role includes rotating after-hours and weekend support due to 24/7 global operations. They must be detail-oriented, resourceful, and able to guide junior analysts. Familiarity with legal terminology, corporate structures, public filings, and engagement terms is also essential.

What You'll Do

The Senior Analyst is responsible for:
• Reviewing new business opportunities for the company, on an expedited basis, to ensure a timely response to company professionals and their clients, to determine if a new engagement can be accepted
• Handling clearances for a defined portfolio (e.g. EMEA, Americas, etc.) as well as clearances outside of assigned queue segment where necessary to manage volume and urgent requests
• Conducting a timely and accurate review of potential conflict concerns and related new business issues (including legal, relationship and reputational risks); verifying completeness and accuracy of new engagement descriptions
• Applying an analytical approach to identify and spot new issues and concerns, and escalating those matters to the leadership of the Conflicts team and company professionals where appropriate
• Applying company conflict policies and procedures as guiding principles in evaluating, tracking and maintaining records of potential issues with new business opportunities
• Liaising and communicating professionally and promptly with Company professionals with a summary, fact-based report of the conflict review and analysis for each new potential engagement, including clear, accurate, and substantive information and summarizing appropriate issues for clients to consider
• Following up on any responses to identify and/or facilitate resolution of potentially complex legal and business relationship issues
• Leveraging internal and external databases and other resources to conduct research, such as to obtain information on the nature of an entity or individual's role in a particular matter, and identifying relevant corporate affiliations
• Ensuring confidentiality and non-disclosure of information involved in the conflicts review process (breach of confidentiality is grounds for dismissal)
• Developing an understanding of the Company's expert and business consulting services, and the nature and complexity of Company professionals' work on behalf of clients, in order to best navigate complex business relationships and new business conflict and relationship analysis
• Working as a collaborative team member as part of the Conflicts group, under the direction of the Manager of Conflicts (The Conflicts group reports to Legal)

How You'll Grow

We are committed to investing and supporting you in your professional development and we have developed a range of programs focused on fostering leadership, growth and development opportunities. We aim to promote continuous learning and individual skills development through on-the-job learning, self-guided professional development courses and certifications. You'll be assigned a dedicated coach to mentor, guide and support you through regular coaching sessions and serve as an advocate for your professional growth.

As you progress through your career at FTI Consulting, we offer tailored programs for critical professional milestones to ensure you are prepared and empowered to take on your next role.

Basic Qualifications

What You Will Need To Succeed
• Bachelor's degree
• 3 years' experience in a conflicts or new business intake function, within a law, auditing, financial, or consulting firm
• Extensive experience using IntApp, Salesforce and Elite
• Ability to travel to FTI office(s) as needed
• Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis; the employer will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Total Wellbeing

Our goal is to support the wellbeing of you and your families-physically, emotionally, and financially. We offer comprehensive benefits such as the following:
• Competitive total compensation, including bonus earning potential
• Full package of benefits plans, including medical, dental, and vision coverage along with life and disability insurance
• Generous paid time off and holidays
• Company matched 401(k) retirement savings plan
• Potential for flexible work arrangements
• Generous paid parental leave with available planning tools, virtual expert coaching services and flex return support.
• Family care benefits, including back-up child/elder care
• Employee wellness platform
• Employee recognition programs
• Paid time off for volunteering in your community
• Corporate matching for charitable donations most important to you
• Make an impact in our communities through company sponsored pro bono work
• Professional development and certification programs
• Free in-office snacks and drinks
• Free smartphone and cellular plan (if applicable)
• FTI Perks & Discounts at retailers and businesses
• Upscale offices close to public transportation

About FTI Consulting

FTI Consulting, Inc. is the leading global expert firm for organizations facing crisis and transformation, with more than 8,300 employees located in 34 countries and territories. Our broad and diverse bench of award-winning experts advise their clients when they are facing their most significant opportunities and challenges. The Company generated $3.7 billion in revenues during fiscal year 20234 In certain jurisdictions, FTI Consulting's services are provided through distinct legal entities that are separately capitalized and independently managed. FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Instagram and LinkedIn .

FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.

Compensation Disclosure: Actual compensation is determined based on a wide array of relevant factors including market considerations, business needs, and an individual's location, skills, level of experience, and qualifications.

title: Epic Certified Cogito Analyst (Front-End Reporting, Epic-Centric, Tableau a plus)
description:
At Divurgent, we employ real people on our Team, not just “resources.” We firmly believe our Team is the driving force behind our successes, and because of that, we are solidly focused on evaluation, maintaining, and improving upon the Divurgent culture by integrating our ELITE Values into everything we do. title: Lead Business Analyst (Remote)
description:
What You Will Do:

As our Lead Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in supporting post-implementation activities for our new project management tool, AdaptiveWork. You will also leverage data and analytics to guide decision-making, optimize operations, and influence key stakeholders within the Communications Business Unit.

Your insights will help drive operational excellence in areas such as cost control, capacity planning, customer satisfaction, and financial performance. You will work cross-functionally and communicate regularly with senior leadership, making strong business acumen, creative problem solving and data storytelling essential.

• Post-Implementation Support:
Act as the system administrator for AdaptiveWork (Planview), managing support, enhancements, and optimization in partnership with the Project Management team.

Use historical and projected business data to identify trends, recommend improvements, and support decision-making across functions.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Partner with Commercial Operations and Communications teams to align on goals, coordinate activities, and drive execution.
• Leadership Engagement:
Present findings and recommendations directly to senior leaders, influencing business strategy through actionable insights.
• Operational Improvements:
Identify and lead process improvement initiatives using data analytics and cross-team collaboration.
• Financial Planning:
Assist in budgeting, forecasting revenue, and recommending capital expenditures and labor costs.
• Standard Work & Best Practices:
Develop and maintain standard operating procedures to promote consistency and efficiency across teams.

Minimum Qualifications:

Required:
• Bachelor’s degree is required for this position.
• 4+ years of related experience
• 1+ year of prior experience using a data visualization tool such as Power BI.

Preferred Skills:
• 2+ years of experience in Excel, Power Apps, SQL, and/or SAP.
• 1+ year of experience using Adaptive Work (Planview).

$100,500 - $215,300 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

title: Business Analyst with OTC trading (100% Remote)
description:

title: Evergreen - Business Analyst - Winnipeg (Remote for Winnipeg)
description:
Shape the Future with Togetherwork
Welcome to Togetherwork, where we believe exceptional talent drives extraordinary outcomes. The role below is part of our Talent Community for Future Opportunities—a place where we connect with professionals who share our passion for innovation, collaboration, and meaningful work.

By expressing your interest in this opportunity, you’re not just applying for a job—you’re joining a network that values growth, creativity, and connection. While this specific position may not be immediately available, we’re excited to learn more about your unique skills and how they align with our future needs.

Let’s build the future, together.

This role is not currently open but we hire for this role on an ongoing basis. Please submit your application if you would like to be contacted once we have an opening. Position location: Winnipeg/Remote

UnionWare, part of Togetherwork, is a comprehensive system that lets unions track membership, grievances, organizing campaigns, events, dues processing and so much more. With powerful search and reporting capabilities, unions will always be able to find what they need and get their work done more efficiently than ever before.

The Business Analyst is responsible for gathering requirements of client needs. The Business Analyst will define and analyze documents and prioritizes all client business requirements while working with the Solutions Architect and development team to determine the best solution.

Responsibilities
• Planning and running small to large client projects.
• Identifying and assessing client’s business requirements.
• Clearly defining scope of work to be completed.
• Documenting detailed requirements for development team to work from.
• Collaborate with Solutions Architect and development team to create solutions.
• Review completed solutions to confirm requirements have been met.
• Present solutions to involved stakeholders.
• Work with other Business Analysts to review and improve standards.
• Work with Project Manager to review project timelines, scoping, and project statuses.
• Work with Data Migration Analyst to ensure success of data migration process.
• Work with Solutions Architect to ensure required solutions are delivered on time and accurately.
• Work with Trainers to help direct training plans for new clients.
• Participates in Scrum meetings, including Sprint Planning and Retrospective meetings.
• Follow all standards that are defined for the role.
• Periodic travel to meet with clients across North America, Australia and the UK (no travel during COVID-19)
• Other related duties as assigned.

Requirements
• A minimum of 3 years of solid experience as a Business Analyst
• A Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Business Administration or an equivalent of work experience is preferred
• Proven experience with high level planning, problem solving and analysis
• Experience with Agile, Scrum, and Kanban
• Strong communication skills and the ability to draw out the needs and requirements of clients
• A natural curiosity and desire to understand “why” things are the way they are
• Quick learner that can be put into new situations and quickly become a domain expert
• Analytical skills along with being able to conceptualize, design and document new features and business requirements
• Excellent client service and communication skills
• Must possess sound decision-making and prioritization skills
• High work standards-work ethic, task completion, consistency, follow up, accuracy/attention to detail, time management
• Personal management skills-accountability, self-management, adaptability, creativity, initiative, implementation skills, and problem solving

Inclusion and Diversity: Togetherwork is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We are a company where diverse backgrounds, experiences and viewpoints are valued. Togetherwork does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, age, ethnic or national origin, or any other basis protected by all local, state or federal laws.

Salary Range Disclosure
The base range represents the low and high end of the Togetherwork salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including, but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Togetherwork's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include discretionary bonuses, long term incentives, profit sharing, 3 weeks paid vacation and more.

Salary Range
$60,000 - 80,000 CAD per year

Togetherwork provides integrated software and financial solutions to a wide range of communities and organizations including associations, camps, unions, fraternities & sororities, gyms, dance studios, religious congregations, pet services, and more.

Our mission-critical tools help our customers manage and grow their communities, and enhance the depth and breadth of their member engagement. Our team is united in its desire to help our clients better serve and empower their communities.

title: Remote role for Senior Business Analyst -Healthcare Interoperability
company: Login - TALENT Healthcare Staffing TALENT Healthcare Staffing
description:
Job Summary:

The Senior Business Analyst will play a crucial role in supporting the Interoperability project. This role involves managing and supporting all ELT jobs, the SmileCDR tool, and ensuring a comprehensive understanding of FHIR HL7 standards and mapping. The Senior Business Analyst will also be responsible for engaging with customers to understand their needs and provide solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
• ELT Job Support: Manage and support all Extract, Load, and Transform (ELT) jobs to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
• SmileCDR Tool Management: Oversee the implementation and maintenance of the SmileCDR tool, ensuring it meets project requirements.
• FHIR HL7 Standards: Ensure a thorough understanding of FHIR HL7 standards and mapping to support interoperability.
• Customer Engagement: Engage with customers to understand their needs, gather requirements, and provide solutions.
• Data Mapping and Transformation: Accurately map and transform data to meet FHIR HL7 standards.
• Testing and Validation: Conduct thorough testing and validation of data pipelines and processes.
• Documentation: Provide comprehensive documentation for all processes and procedures.
• Team Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure project success.
• Certifications: Relevant certifications in business analysis, data management, or interoperability standards.
• Industry Knowledge: Knowledge of Interoperability requirements and healthcare data standards.
Qualifications:
• Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
• Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a business analyst role, with a focus on data management and interoperability.
• Technical Skills: Proficiency in ELT processes, FHIR HL7 standards, and data mapping.
• Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to engage with customers and stakeholders effectively.
• Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve issues quickly.
• Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
• Certifications: Relevant certifications in business analysis, data management, or interoperability standards.
• Industry Knowledge: Knowledge of Interoperability requirements and healthcare data standards.
• Experience with SmileCDR or similar tools is a plus.

title: Payments Business Analyst (CHIPS, FEDWIRE, SWIFT) - W2
description:
Job Description:

Job Summary:

We are seeking an experienced professional with strong expertise in the Payments domain to support the analysis, design, and delivery of end-to-end payment processing solutions. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of wire transfer systems (CHIPS, FEDWIRE, SWIFT), familiarity with ISO 20022 standards, and a proven ability to gather business requirements, manage Agile artifacts, and lead cross-functional teams.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead the analysis of end-to-end payment processing flows and ensure alignment with business goals.
• Work with stakeholders to gather, document, and prioritize functional and non-functional requirements.
• Create and manage Epics, User Stories, and Acceptance Criteria using Jira in an Agile delivery model.
• Collaborate with business and technical teams to define and document technical plans and solution designs.
• Provide subject matter expertise in wire payment networks including CHIPS, FEDWIRE, and SWIFT.
• Interpret and apply ISO 20022 standards within payment messaging frameworks.
• Support UAT, defect triage, and solution validation during delivery.
• Communicate effectively with business, product, and technology stakeholders.
• Drive project planning activities and ensure timely delivery of project milestones.

Required Skills & Experience:
• Prior experience working on Payments-related projects (mandatory).
• Strong understanding of CHIPS, FEDWIRE, SWIFT payment systems.
• Deep knowledge of ISO 20022 messaging standards.
• Proven expertise in business analysis, including requirements gathering, process modeling, and gap analysis.
• Proficiency in Jira must be able to write and manage epics, user stories, and backlogs.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Solid project management and stakeholder coordination skills.
• Ability to develop and document technical plans in collaboration with architects and developers.

title: Business Analyst`
description:
Iron Bow Technologies is for people who believe trust is paramount, transformation is embraced, and the future is here, because "What we do matters!"

We are a next generation solutions provider, delivering mission success across government, healthcare, and commercial industries. Iron Bow relies on our passionate people, long standing partnerships, and strategic thinking to solve your most critical challenges.

Whether we team with clients, colleagues, or partners, we put each other first. It’s The Iron Bow Way.

THE HIGH LEVEL

We’re looking for a detail-oriented and proactive individual to support IT procurement and finance operations across a variety of technology projects. In this remote role, you’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to manage suppliers, track project costs, and support financial reporting. This is a great opportunity for someone with a background in IT Finance or Procurement who enjoys working independently, staying organized, and contributing to high-impact initiatives.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
• Liaise with internal teams (Engineering, Infrastructure, Operations, Project Management) and external project teams to identify procurement needs, prospective suppliers, and necessary equipment or services.
• Coordinate with suppliers and project managers to obtain and communicate updates on goods and services.
• Maintain and manage procurement tracking spreadsheets and provide regular status reports (weekly or monthly) on progress.
• Monitor inventory levels to ensure a consistent and efficient flow of goods.
• Review and analyze invoices to verify accuracy of delivered goods and services.
• Support the management of project budgets for all technology-related initiatives.
• Identify and address inefficiencies or issues within the procurement and project processes.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
• You have 2+ years of experience in IT Finance or IT Procurement roles.
• You hold a bachelor’s degree, preferably in Accounting, Business, or Finance.
• You possess strong knowledge of Microsoft tools, including SharePoint and Excel.
• You have proven experience working as a procurement specialist.
• You are experienced with business and financial applications, including supporting financial systems, and managing project costs.
• You ideally hold additional certification in procurement or a related field.
• You have a solid understanding of IT concepts and systems.
• You demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills, critical for success in a remote work environment.
• You possess strong negotiation and problem-solving abilities.
• You bring exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong virtual relationships.
• You are a team player with a proven ability to collaborate effectively in distributed teams.
• You are highly organized, self-motivated, and capable of managing responsibilities independently in a 100% remote role.
• You have experience assisting with the development of Earned Value reports for projects.
• You are familiar with daily cost tracking and control processes.
• You have supported the creation of Pro-forma invoices for cost-reimbursable projects.
• You have contributed to the development of monthly financial summary reports across multiple projects.
• You have participated in performing invoice reconciliations.
• You have worked closely with internal accounting teams to ensure budgeting accuracy and the correct use of accounting codes.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
• No travel is expected for this position, and it will be 100% remote.

WHY YOU’LL LOVE IT
• Enjoy the freedom and work-life balance with a remote role, allowing you to contribute from anywhere while staying connected with a collaborative, distributed team.
• Play a key role in supporting high-visibility technology projects by working closely with procurement, finance, and engineering teams to drive cost efficiency and operational success.
• Gain valuable experience in IT finance and procurement while expanding your skills in project budgeting, vendor management, and financial reporting—all within a dynamic, tech-forward environment.
• Iron Bow is rapidly growing and with growth comes opportunity for all. There is palpable energy and momentum across the company that is easy to tap into and be inspired by.
• Be a part of organizational transformation. Now’s the time to join. Iron Bow is redesigning the customer and employee experience. This new approach elevates all and truly enables success.

#LI-EC1 #LI-Remote

OUR EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER COMMITMENT

Iron Bow Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Iron Bow are based on relevant business considerations, such as operational needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or gender expression, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic prohibited by law. Iron Bow will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

title: Senior Business Analyst/Product Owner
description:
Overview
HaloMD

Who We Are:

HaloMD specializes in Independent Dispute Resolution (IDR) through The No Surprises Act and state regulations for out-of-network healthcare providers, leveraging advanced technology and deep industry expertise to secure optimized reimbursements.
Job Summary:

The Product Owner is responsible for planning, coordinating, and managing the development and implementation of software applications across the organization. This role involves working closely with stakeholders, vendors, and cross-functional teams through the full SDLC process to ensure that new applications are successfully deployed, meet business requirements, and are integrated with existing systems. The role also includes aspects of product ownership, including managing application backlogs, prioritizing enhancements, and ensuring that new features deliver business value.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities
• Project Management:
• Lead the planning, scheduling, and execution of application development and implementation projects.
• Ensure that projects are completed on time, within scope, and aligned with business objectives.
• Adopt agile methodology, apply its principles, and train users
• Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive)
• Assist in tracking progress of deliverables and communicating
• Build and maintain strong relationships with business and IT users, both, onshore and offshore
• Ensure application development efforts are prioritized based on business value, user needs, and alignment with product goals
• Business Analysis / Stakeholder Engagement:
• Work with business units to gather and document requirements.
• Act as the primary point of contact between the IT department, vendors, and business users, ensuring alignment between technical delivery and business needs.
• Work with business users, technology team, and external clients/vendors to identify and understand business needs related to application UI, integration, reporting and bug fix needs
• Elicit, analyze and validate requirements, understand dependencies and perform gap analysis
• Document requirements and specifications, and provide to all stakeholders for approval
• Coordinate closely with developers to ensure requirements are communicated, implemented, and aligned with the broader product vision.
• Work closely with business users to verify business requirements are met and assist them with testing
• Maintain a prioritized backlog of features and enhancements, incorporating input from users, stakeholders, and internal teams.
• Vendor Management:
• Coordinate with third-party vendors for software design, delivery, customization, and support.
• Team Coordination:
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, operations, and business units, to ensure seamless integration and operation of new applications.
• Quality Assurance:
• Oversee and partake in the testing processes to ensure that applications function as intended.
• Identify and resolve issues during the implementation process.
• Training and Support:
• Develop and deliver training programs for end-users.
• Provide ongoing support post-implementation to ensure user adoption and satisfaction.
• Risk Management:
• Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies.
• Reporting:
• Generate reports on implementation progress, budget status, and key performance indicators.
• Present findings to senior management.

Qualifications
Qualifications
Education and/or Experience
• Education:
• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
• Experience:
• 10+ years of experience in IT project management, business analysis, software implementation, or a related role.
• Experience within the healthcare/healthcare technology industry preferred, not required
• Technical Skills:
• Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Monday, Jira, Azure DevOps, etc.)
• Experience creating application UI mockups/designs preferred
• Understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) in an Agile methodology
• Soft Skills:
• Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
• Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Perks & Benefits:
• Fully Remote – Work from anywhere within the United States with reliable high-speed internet
• Multiple medical plan options
• Health Savings Account with company contributions
• Dental & vision coverage for you and your dependents
• 401k with Company match
• Vacation, sick time & Company paid holidays
• Company wellbeing program with health insurance incentives
What’s Next?

If you’re ready to bring your skills and passion to our growing team, we want to hear from you! Apply today and help us create a future where success is the standard.

#IND123

title: Graduate Consultant - Business Analyst for EMPC with tech background
description:
What happens when you have fascinating clients with challenging problems on the one hand and passionate software developers looking to build future-focused solutions on the other? This in-between is where Business Analysts reside, acting as a bridge between the client and team. You will establish the outcomes software must achieve, assess how it will be used, and then generate bold ideas with our developers to create custom applications. You will work with clients across a variety of sectors and ensure the business-critical software solutions we develop deliver real business value every time.

As a Business Analyst Graduate at Thoughtworks, you will be part of agile teams driving digital transformation and delivering high-impact solutions for mid-to-large enterprise clients. This is an ideal role for individuals interested in building a long-term career in consulting while leveraging a strong understanding of technology and business strategy.

Our entry-level consultants jumpstart their careers with the First Year Graduate Experience: our year-long program that starts with Thoughtworks University, an immersive three-week training, plus monthly sessions dedicated to specific topics. And it's important to call out that we consider tech talent from all walks of life. Whether you're a Computer Science major with less than one year of professional experience, a coding boot camp graduate or a career changer who is working toward becoming a software developer, you have the opportunity to grow in our community of passionate technologists.

Job responsibilities
• Manage stakeholders and technical delivery teams.
• You will work in agile teams that facilitate organizational transformations for medium- and large-scale businesses.
• Translate business problems into clear, actionable requirements.
• You will be an effective liaison between the client and a team consisting of SMEs, C-suite executives, Experience Designers, Product Managers, Consultant Developers and QAs.
• Collaborate with teammates on the analysis and design of complex business applications, strategy, and outcomes using the latest technologies.
• Facilitate and contribute to agile ceremonies, product discovery, and requirement gathering sessions.
• Evangelize Agile, Lean and Continuous Development analysis best practices.

Job qualificationsTechnical Skills
• You have less than 1 year of professional experience working as a business analyst.
• Technical background on software engineering.
• Basic understanding of CI/CD pipelines and software delivery concepts.
• Experience with agile principles (Scrum/Kanban).
• Knowledge in technology solutions supports business goals.
• Ability to map out user journeys, process flows, or system interactions.
• Exposure to modeling or analysis tools such as JIRA, Confluence, Miro, Lucidchart.

Professional Skills
• Effective communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Strategic mindset and business awareness.
• Problem-solving and structured thinking.
• Initiative and proactivity in collaborative settings.
• Confidence to speak up and ask clarifying questions.
• You thrive in a collaborative, flat environment that values transparency, openness, feedback and change.
• You have a passion for learning and sharing knowledge as well as a desire to create meaningful solutions for business problems.
• You have a genuine passion for quality software.

Other things to knowLearning & Development

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a dynamic and inclusive community of bright and supportive colleagues who are revolutionizing tech. As a leading technology consultancy, we're pushing boundaries through our purposeful and impactful work. For 30+ years, we've delivered extraordinary impact together with our clients by helping them solve complex business problems with technology as the differentiator. Bring your brilliant expertise and commitment for continuous learning to Thoughtworks. Together, let's be extraordinary.

#LI-Remote

title: SAP Business Analyst, Stf - 1LMX / SAP Project System Networks / PP
description:
Job ID: 695570BR
Date posted: Jun. 12, 2025

Description:
Join Lockheed Martin's digital transformation journey as we accelerate the OneLM Mission-Driven Transformation through our 1LMX program. This strategic priority is reshaping our operations and business processes to better serve our customers in terms of cost, quality, and capabilities, while delivering the speed, agility, and insights necessary to stay ahead of rapidly-evolving threats.

1LMX ERP Production Operations IT Team is hiring a Business Analyst with experience in SAP Project System Networks, SAP's Production Planning (PP), and complex assembly to support transforming Lockheed Martin businesses using the latest SAP S/4HANA ERP systems to drive to a common set of streamlined processes and deliver results for our customers.

What You Will Be Doing:
In this role, you will apply your specific experience and expertise in Project System Networks to facilitate the development, implementation, and sustainment of the ERP system and processes. You will work across multiple project teams to optimize end-to-end processes, including system design, development, configuration, unit testing, and operational assessment readiness. Additionally, you will be responsible for authoring functional specifications for enhancements, conversions, master data records, reports, and custom transactions. Furthermore, you will be responsible for unit testing, integration testing, documentation and training of the end user community. You will provide the following capability to the project team:
• Leveraging your experience in Project System Networks to help guide our Master Scheduling & Demand Management team
• Analyzing Production Operations business processes and procedures for improvement and system applicability
• Providing clearly defined solutions supporting Manufacturing Production Operations for configuration of SAP and supporting business processes
• Performing gap analysis and system re-engineering of SAP activities
• Participating and leading in blueprinting, configuration, testing and production support
• Responsibilities include system design, development, configuration, unit testing, and operational assessment readiness.

Who You Are:
You're a passionate, resourceful, and tactical individual who thrives in a dynamic team environment. As a collaborative and driven professional, you're excited about the opportunity to work side-by-side with a talented team of IT professionals to drive continuous results and develop effective solutions that make a meaningful impact on the IT organization.

What's In It For You:
From onsite to remote, we offer flexible work schedules to comprehensive benefits investing in your future and security, learn more about Lockheed Martin's comprehensive benefits package here.

Lockheed Martin provides the resources and the flexibility to enable inspiration and focus! If you have the passion and courage to dream big, work hard, and have fun doing what you love, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Further Information About This Opportunity:
This position is fully remote. US citizenship is required due to program requirements and system access.
Basic Qualifications:
• Significant experience in SAP Project System (PS) Networks
• Significant experience in SAP PP module
• Knowledge of or familiarity with complex assembly
• Experience with ERP / SAP applications in a large enterprise environment
• Experience with SAP system Configuration
• Experience authoring functional specs based on customer requirements
• Experience working with ABAP developers to design/standardize customized functional solutions
• Experience supporting full cycle implementation, which includes Gap Analysis, Requirements gathering, Blue printing, Development, Testing, Reporting, Go-live and Post Go-live support
• Experience facilitating data driven decisions
• Ability to apply functional knowledge to meet operational business needs to increase revenue and reduce cost
• Demonstrated problem solving, analytic skills and troubleshooting skills associated with the integration of multiple IT systems.
• Effective communication and facilitation skills - ability to converse technically and functionally.
• US citizenship is required due to program requirements and system access

Desired Skills:
• Significant experience with complex assembly
• Experience with SAP Sales Orders and Contracts (SD)
• Experience with Production Planning Master Data Management using SAP's Master Data Governance (MDG) tool
• Experience with Agile Scrum methodology and tools (particularly Jira)
• Experience working in Aerospace and Defense
• Experience with iDoc (interface document) processing
• Experience with Manufacturing Execution information systems and integration with ERP SAP systems
• Experience Facilitating change and learning activities
• Experience working with Fiori and/or Personas

Clearance Level: None
Other Important Information You Should Know
Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Ability to Work Remotely: Full-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work remotely full time at a location other than a Lockheed Martin designated office/job site. Employees may travel to a Lockheed Martin office for periodic meetings.
Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week
Pay Rate: The annual base salary range for this position in most major metropolitan areas in California and New York is $114,700 - $198,720. For states not referenced above, the salary range for this position will reflect the candidate's final work location. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Lockheed Martin considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/ training, key skills as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer. Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays. This position is incentive plan eligible.
Pay Rate: The annual base salary range for this position in California and New York (excluding most major metropolitan areas), Colorado, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, New Jersey, Vermont, Washington or Washington DC is $99,700 - $175,835. For states not referenced above, the salary range for this position will reflect the candidate's final work location. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Lockheed Martin considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/ training, key skills as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer. Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays. (Washington state applicants only) Non-represented full-time employees: accrue at least 10 hours per month of Paid Time Off (PTO) to be used for incidental absences and other reasons; receive at least 90 hours for holidays. Represented full time employees accrue 6.67 hours of Vacation per month; accrue up to 52 hours of sick leave annually; receive at least 96 hours for holidays. PTO, Vacation, sick leave, and holiday hours are prorated based on start date during the calendar year. This position is incentive plan eligible.
Lockheed Martin is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified candidates will be considered without regard to legally protected characteristics.
The application window will close in 90 days; applicants are encouraged to apply within 5 - 30 days of the requisition posting date in order to receive optimal consideration.
At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. We place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering an inclusive environment built upon integrity and corporate responsibility.

If this sounds like a culture you connect with, you're invited to apply for this role. Or, if you are unsure whether your experience aligns with the requirements of this position, we encourage you to search on Lockheed Martin Jobs, and apply for roles that align with your qualifications.
