title: Lead Strategy & Market Analyst (Oil & Gas)
description:
Our client, a global leader in the Oil & Gas industry is seeking a Lead Strategy & Market Analyst to add to their Facilities Planning Department.
• This position is an EXPAT role and requires relocation to Saudi Arabia. Must be a current holder of a North American passport**

Facilities Planning Department is responsible for the development and coordination of the capital program throughout the Company.

The Fuels & Chemicals Division comprises of three groups: Downstream Development Group, Refining Group, and Chemicals Group. The activities of F&C FPD span the entire Capital Planning Process including idea/opportunity creation, business case analysis, alternative options development, leading the multi-discipline integrated project teams through the preparation of Design Basis Scoping Papers (Front End Loading), and preparation of expenditure request documentation for presentation to Corporate Management. The Division is also responsible for leading broader master planning activities for the Kingdom downstream facilities and optimization/review of capital deployed to provide the highest possible benefit as well as leading Technical Due Diligence efforts on potential acquisition targets in the downstream sector.

Responsibilities
• Conduct feasibility studies on refineries and petrochemical facilities and develop long-term business strategies related to these facilities.
• Lead integrated project teams to prepare design basis scoping papers to define capital projects involving refineries and petrochemical investments.
• Prepare expenditure request documentation and present it to Corporate Management.
• Interface with Operating Organizations, New Business Development, Engineering, Project Management, and Corporate Staff.
• Perform process/system and economic evaluations of existing and potential new refining and petrochemical facilities.
• Direct evaluations of major refining and petrochemical facilities as performed by others.
• Prepare and make presentations to Corporate Management on refining petrochemical investment opportunities.
• Provide full-time consultation to management and other organizations.
• Mentor the training of future Facilities Planning Specialists.

Education & Experience Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering.
• Must have 5+ years of experience in the oil & gas industry, specifically Downstream Fuels
• Advanced Education in Economics is highly preferred
• Excellent written and oral technical presentation skills.
• 10+ years of experience in:
• Performing economic evaluations, feasibility studies and preparing requests for budgetary approvals.
• Professional consultant in planning and executing engineering studies.
• Applying and analyzing process/system simulation and economics of refinery or petrochemical operations, particularly LP modeling experience

OUTSTANDING RELOCATION PACKAGE & BENEFITS!

Client Description

Our client energizes the world economy.

They occupy a special position in the global energy industry. They are one of the world’s largest producers of hydrocarbon energy and chemicals, with among the lowest Upstream carbon intensities of any major producer.

With their significant investment in technology and infrastructure, they strive to maximize the value of the energy they produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance the company’s value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, they combine market discipline with a generations’ spanning view of the future, born of their nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom’s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven them to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that they supply.

They are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.

Working environment

Their high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities they offer, and are remunerated accordingly.

Their employees work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, they are faced with addressing some of the world’s biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, they invest heavily in talent development.

They have a proud history of educating and training their workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through their workforce development programs – one of the largest in the world.

Country/Region: Saudi Arabia

title: Operations Business Analyst - (Critical Thinker, SQL) Remote - Sunnyvale,CA - Now Hiring
description:
Description:
• *Actual current End Date is 07/31/2025. Will update End Date upon Work Order creation**

Position Summary:
• The Walmart Global Marketplace, Program & Strategy team is responsible for defining, enforcing and promoting policies and programs to ensure best in class Customer Experience and hence drive Customer Satisfaction across our marketplace business.
• Core Functions include Define, develop and review the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Understand and use various custom tools to support program operations.
• Identify and monitor program performance KPIs. Communicate closely with cross-functional partners to address non-routine questions as they arise. Prepare reports detailing program status to date

Position Description:
• This position is responsible for scaling and operations of Marketplace Business Gating Program. An individual in this position will be expected create, update and review gating rules to ensure we are capturing the correct assortment to be restricted.

Minimum Qualifications:
• Bachelor's or Masters degree (Business or Technical field preferred)
• 2+ years of experience in program operations and technical support roles
• Strong analytical skills: MS Excel® skills, incl. functions (logical, lookup and reference, math and trigonometry, etc.) & pivot tables; Excel Macros, SQL, and Python skills preferred
• Experience performing quantitative and qualitative research and communicating results to leadership
• Excellent personal task management skills and ability to handle multiple assignments
• Strong written (including email) and verbal (including phone) communication skills
• Prior eCommerce and/or Supply Chain experience is a strong plus.

Additional Information :

What project or initiative will they be working on?
• Business Gating for US Marketplace

Will this role be hybrid?
• No

If hybrid, how many days per week will need to be in office?
• Fully remote

Top 3 Skills Needed or Required

1. Critical Thinker / Attention to Detail - Able to identify areas of improvement and propose ways to increase efficiency. Has a strong attention to details. This individual will need to be able to understand the problem from a holistic point of view and identify the small details that really matter.
2. Driven - Self Starter who can be reliable and available to help meet our teams ambitious goals. Does not need to be constantly monitored.
3. Curious / Resourceful - has the motivation to understand why things or processes are the way they are. Takes the initiative to find the solution.

What are the day-to-day responsibilities?
• Analyst will be building, maintaining and troubleshooting business rules that restrict specific assortment from being listed on Walmarts MP.

What is the makeup of the team?
• Analyst will have two peers and will work closely with the Sr. Business Analyst on the team. I will oversee KPIs and Goals for the team.

Required Skills : Critical Thinking

Basic Qualification :

Additional Skills : Business Analyst

Background Check : No

Drug Screen : No

title: Business Analyst | Associations & Non-Profits
description:
fusionSpan is a dynamic, fast-paced hybrid and remote work environment that prioritizes innovation, trust, and community in everything we do. We are a team of highly-committed individuals inspired by technology's impact on society, and we recognize our work's role in the well-being of our nonprofit clients and the communities they serve.

As an AI-first organization, we keep our eyes tuned to the horizon, finding new ways to leverage cutting-edge technologies in ways that drive improvements in operational efficiency and impact, both for our clients and for our internal team.

We are looking for Business Analysts who have prior experience at a Non-Profit association and have some experience with an AMS/CRM. As a Business Analyst, you are able to work independently and both document and craft solutions with support from development team members.

Location: Rockville, MD. Hybrid role with 2-3 days in office.

Responsibilities:
• Provide business analysis consulting for enterprise projects spanning multiple phases and multiple platforms,
• Work with development team members to craft innovative and potentially complex, cutting edge solutions to address functional gaps,
• Serve as a mentor and advisor to other consultant team members,
• Coordinate and communicate with external, client resources effectively and professionally,
• Maintain project methodologies and procedures for projects, platforms, features, teams, divisions, and relevant company-wide processes,
• Understand data requirements and coordinate with data analysts for any data needs
• Work in tandem with project managers and development teams to ensure on-time, on-budget work products.

Required Qualifications:
• Bachelors degree
• 2+ years of business analysis experience working in the non-profit or association industry

Preferred:
• Experience on AMS or CRM such as NetForum, Personify, Aptify, Impexium, MS Dynamics, etc.
• Experience administering or heavily using Fonteva, Nimble AMS or other Salesforce solutions for non-profit organizations
• Finance and accounting or implementation of technology platforms for these

What We Offer:
• Health (PPO) dental & vision plan - 100% covered for employee
• Long/Short-term disability insurance - 100% covered for employee
• Life and AD&D insurance - 100% covered for employee
• 401K with up to 5% matching contribution
• 15 days of paid vacation - increases with tenure
• 10 paid federal holidays
• 12 weeks for parental leave

About fusionSpan

fusionSpan is a fast-paced, high-energy global firm with a highly motivated team. This role will experience high work demands under tight timelines requiring a flexible and adaptable approach to daily priorities. We are open to qualified candidates worldwide even though our job opportunities are posted for a specific region.

Check out our Great Place to Work Certified Badge here.

Our Company Values:
• Trust: We believe trust is the foundation of success, and build it through unwavering integrity, transparency, and open communication. We deliver on promises, address challenges directly, and hold ourselves accountable to excellence in all interactions with clients, partners, and teammates.
• Innovation: We understand that excellence and innovation go hand-in-hand and are committed to developing forward-looking, creative solutions that meet our clients' evolving needs and move the industry forward. We embrace change, celebrate creativity, and prioritize quality to create a new standard of performance.
• Community: We are a community-first organization committed to creating a culture of collaboration, inclusivity, and respect
where each voice is heard and all contributions are valued. We prioritize responsible and sustainable practices on our path to positively impact those we serve.

title: Pricing Analyst - Customer Mapping (Remote/Virtual)
description:
ARE YOU A CURRENT US FOODS EMPLOYEE? PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY THROUGH OUR INTERNAL WORKDAY CAREER SITE

Join Our Community of Food People!

The Pricing Analyst - Customer Mapping completes and leads analysis to ensure SKU pricing impacts for customers mapped to new markets are properly set up prior to the transition and remain in-line with project plans. They support projects tied to Customer Remapping, M&A, or other customer transition projects where customers are to be served by new or different distribution centers. They align Merchandising, Replenishment, and Sales departments with SKU pricing needs. They collaborate and proactively address pricing and replenishment issues. They proactively collaborate with the Field to oversee customer transitions (start-up & ramp-down) and assortment transitions by providing the local Pricing team with process expertise and help facilitate cross-functional support. After the transition, they monitor pricing and help to diagnose and fix problematic errors until a full handoff to the field is complete.

This position is remote which means the work can be completed from anywhere in the United States except Hawaii or United States Territories.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
• Completes analysis of SKU pricing impacts for each customer move.
• Attends weekly meetings with Replenishment and Merchandising for each project to ensure the project is on-track.
• Collaborates with Replenishment to validate and proactively addresses pricing opportunities.
• Monitors KPIs after transitions to ensure handoff to the new Market.
• Reviews and manages price deviations and exceptions for impacted customers.
• Answers pricing queries escalated from Sales and other US Foods employees as needed.
• Partners with Chain Based Selling (CBS) team to ensure proper documentation for Vendor agreements and Agency letters.
• Analyze and develop pricing recommendations to support field and conduct special pricing reviews for new customer acquisition for the designated DC, in partnership with Strategic Pricing Manager.
• Identifies costing errors and work with relevant stakeholders to resolve them.
• Identifies and escalate system setup errors as needed.
• Monitors and identify opportunities by analyzing and reporting on margin and market pricing.
• Manages and uploads exceptions for vendor price list from local/regional suppliers. Maintains Customer Pricing Rationale (CPR) back-up for area.
• Other duties as assigned by manager.

SUPERVISION:
• N/A

RELATIONSHIPS
• Internal: Network Planning, M&A, Supply Chain Excellence, Field Leaders, and Staff including Pricing Manager; Region Pricing Manager; Area President; AVP of Merchandising and Marketing and area sales team (VP Sales, Sales Manager, DSMs, CSC, and TMs), Merchandising, Replenishment, NSAL, Finance, Category Management, Local Sales, National Sales, Transportation.
• External: Customers, Vendors.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
• Remote: This role is fully remote, and the associate is expected to perform assigned responsibilities from a home-based environment.

Minimum Qualifications
• 3 years of pricing experience
• Strong quantitative and analytical skills
• Proven experience working with, and supporting, sales teams
• Proven experience following a project plan
• Able to access information within established pricing databases and/or analyze data made available from analysts
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and draw linkages with business impact
• Familiarity with analytics and supply chain planning and buying systems
• Ability to synthesize key information, present in vendor and customer facing calls to influence key decisions
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office i.e., Excel, Word, etc.
• Up to 10% travel

Preferred Qualifications

title: S4 SD Business Analyst (202877)
description:
BCTG’s direct Life Sciences client is looking for an SAP SD Business Systems Analyst

The SAP SD Business Systems Analyst investigates, analyzes and effectively communicates requirements of the information systems applications user community (SAP) to provide functional knowledge required for systems development and problem resolution. Works directly with the business system users to resolve SAP issues and optimize utilization of the system. Responsible for the planning, design and implementation of SAP system-based business process enhancements. Provides testing support, training and full documentation of functional needs and software solutions.

Must have Batch management, Serialization, Pricing, and Pricing procedures, S/4 and Fiori (preferred)

What you’ll do:
• Translates user requirements into functional specifications. Writes and approves validation deliverable documentation such as user requirements, validation strategy documentation, testing plans and design documentation within SAP.
• Defines, documents, and manages project scope, goals, priorities, deliverables and timelines that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.
• Designs solutions and configures applications (SAP) to support day-to-day operations and business needs, and creates queries to support ad-hoc reporting requirements.
• Works with business community to troubleshoot and resolve system issues. Provides after hours oncall support as assigned to address emergency and urgent issues.
• Assists the business users with activities related to SAP software change requests, including creation and execution of test scripts to test business functionality, establishment of training plans and creation of user training documentation.
• Identifies opportunities for improvement and makes constructive suggestions for change.

What you’ll bring (Minimum Requirements):

Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Engineering, or related Business discipline, required.
• Ten (10) years’ work experience with SAP Configuration in designated module. Must have completed at least one SAP full cycle Implementation. ABAP Programming preferred.
• Five (5) years Related Information Technology Experience with analysis, validation, and documentation.
• SAP Certification with one or more core, preferred
• Experience with ABAP Programming, preferred
• Previous experience in FDA regulated industry
• Communication Skills: Written, verbal and presentation; ability to engage, inspire and influence people.
• Achieves Results: Ability to work independently and honor commitment to objectives.

title: Sr. Technical Business Analyst (100% Remote) in USA
description:
Sr. Technical Business Analyst (100% Remote) - Hire Dynamics - USA - work from home job

Company: Hire Dynamics

Job description: Description :

Join us on this exciting journey to transform the staffing industry!

Sr. Technical Business Analyst (100% remote)

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S.

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa.

Sr. Technical Business Analyst Job Summary:

The Sr. Technical Business Analyst partners with the Product Owner to lead software development efforts based on established business initiatives. The BA gathers and analyzes data in support of business cases, proposed objectives, and system requirements. This role is on an agile team, providing expertise to the engineering and QA teams regarding business process and requirements, as well as providing support to the product owner for user story development and grooming.

Sr. Technical Business Analyst Essential Job Functions:
• Collaborates with Product Owner to decompose large epics into features and user stories that aim to solve defined business goals
• Will serve as day-to-day liaison between the Scrum Team and the Product Owner/Stakeholders
• Attends standard scrum ceremonies, acting as the voice of the customer, while pushing for continuous improvement of the Scrum Team
• Communicates business goals & expected outcomes to Scrum teams so they can produce innovative solutions that produce the desired outcome
• Gathers and analyzes data in support of business cases, proposed objectives, and systems requirements
• Produces and provides quality requirements to engineers by leading the creation and refinement of user stories, detailed acceptance criteria, and applicable testing criteria
• Works to establish solutions in a collaborative environment, building relationships based on trust, rapport, and unified goals.
• Ensures Scrum Team is prepared to execute development sprints by clarifying questions, understand impact analysis, and backlog management.
• Applies different techniques to facilitate meetings and workshops, create a shared understanding with stakeholders, and engages team-members effectively
• Strong interpersonal skills to partner with technical and non-technical team members alike
• With minimal direction, the BA researches applicable problems or issues, recommending a course of action to Product Owner for resolution
• With minimal assistance, uses analytical and problem-solving skills to resolve complex business and/or data problems
• Provides input to root cause analysis after issues have surfaced as a result of work that has passed through the team and into the production environment

Sr. Technical Business Analyst Qualifications, Education & Experience:
• Must have previous experience as a Business Analyst or Product Owner for software engineering teams
• 3+ years of experience as an analyst, either within a business discipline or IT
• 2+ year of experience operating in and Agile delivery process
• Extensive experience creating user stories and acceptance criteria to express requirements
• Experience providing product management support such as prioritization and backlog grooming
• Ability to manage tasks using the organization’s Product Management methodology
• Ability to host and facilitate standard scrum ceremonies as needed
• Knowledge of software development practice, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and work experience
• Demonstrated aptitude for logical thinking and the ability to see the larger picture
• Knowledge of technical/business environment
• Ability to solicit and collect application and technology requirements
• Must be technical in nature, with expertise in SQL and API tools like Postman, SoapUI
• Experience with diagramming data flows and business processes using diagramming tools such as LucidChart and/or Miro
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• Ability to self-motivate and work independently with limited supervision
• Strong organization and time management skills
• Experience with JIRA, Aha!, requirements management tools
• Staffing Industry experience, a plus
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Business-related discipline

Employbridge offers a competitive base salary plus monthly bonus potential!

Additional benefits package for full time colleagues that includes:
• Comprehensive Medical, Dental & Vision benefits starting on the first of the month following hire date
• 8 Paid Holidays per year
• 2 Floating Holidays per year
• Paid Time Off
• 401(k)
• Wellness Program
• Parental Leave

The anticipated annual base salary for this position in the US is $100,000 to $110,000. This range does not include any other compensation components or other benefits that an individual may be eligible for. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

title: Sr Business Analyst, Growth Marketing and Strategy (Remote Eligible) in  McLean, VA in Capital One (job Id: 1676439622)
description:
Job title: Sr Business Analyst, Growth Marketing and Strategy (Remote Eligible)

Company: Capital One

Job description: Recruiting: VA - McLean, United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Sr Business Analyst, Growth Marketing and Strategy (Remote Eligible)

This is your opportunity to join the Growth team of Capital One’s fast-growing consumer app: Capital One Shopping. Within Capital One, the Shopping team is working on a new consumer product that seeks to change the way people buy things online. We believe that no matter where you shop, it should be easy to buy things at the best price. We’re focused on scaling our products to millions of customers and refining the experience to create a product that customers can’t live without.

We are looking for a Sr Business Analyst to lead our marketing strategy on mobile devices and supercharge the user growth of our mobile application. You will have the opportunity to drive customer acquisition across a suite of digital marketing channels and influence new product developments based on your learnings and analysis.

To be successful in the role, you will need to be a well-rounded 'business athlete’ — a creative, analytical, and technically proficient problem solver who understands both the dynamics of the business and the tech landscape. The ideal candidate is resourceful, motivated, and self-sufficient, with demonstrated success in spearheading cross-functional projects that drive the growth and success of a business.

We provide competitive compensation, geographic flexibility, a generous vacation policy, and top-tier benefits. This team operates remotely, with associates working from a variety of US locations. Capital One office perks are available if you choose to sit in one of our office locations (including complimentary snacks & coffee, onsite fitness center, and chef-prepared meals).

Responsibilities

Identify, prioritize, and launch marketing campaigns designed to maximize user acquisition across paid and owned channels

Conduct A/B testing to identify the optimal creatives, landing pages, and experiences to grow our mobile user base

Develop a monitoring suite to track key performance indicators

Manage to results by establishing a business model based on following the data

Become an expert on mobile attribution in a privacy focused environment

Gain a deep understanding of our mobile user experience and those provided by our competitors

Drive mobile product ideation, analysis, and development in partnership with business analysis, product, and software development teams

Set the strategic roadmap for mobile growth initiatives to drive long term success

Who We’re Looking For

You’re highly analytical -- not afraid to pull your own data & adapt your strategy based on new information

You have strong business judgment: you are a tenacious decision maker, able to bring a healthy, aggressive, yet responsible approach to business

You have impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through interpersonal and negotiation skills

You love to ship products and projects with impact and business value

You enjoy teaching yourself new skills and driving whatever aspect of a project is needed to succeed

You have an affinity for the fast-paced, changing environment of a start-up, a positive attitude, and a get-it-done personality

You thrive and help set the pace in a company where the people around you have an exceptionally high level of commitment; you wouldn’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves and lead an occasional late-night work session to help your teams succeed

You take personal responsibility for the productivity and results of any team you are a part of

Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering)

At least 1 year of experience in analysis

Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering

1+ years of experience in Statistical model building

1+ years of experience in market research

1+ years of experience in SQL querying

2+ years of experience in business analysis

1+ years of experience in consulting

Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.

Location is New York City: $112,400 - $128,300 for Sr. Business Analyst

Location is San Francisco, California: $119,100 - $135,900 for Sr. Business Analyst

Remote roles in other areas of New York & California, and across Colorado & Washington: $95,300 - $108,700 for Sr. Business Analyst

Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate’s offer letter.

This role is also eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). Incentives could be discretionary or non discretionary depending on the plan.

Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the . Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.

No agencies please. Capital One is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law. Job Description

The Student Lending Delivery group supports our newly built loan origination platform in partnership with an in-house development team and business line product owners.

We are looking for a Business Analyst to become a SME in our new system and serve as a liaison between end users, internal stakeholders, and technology partners. Primary responsibilities include
• Provide production support and research of application or integration issues working with developers, end-users, and other support partners. Investigate reported issues to identify system problems vs user error vs training deficiencies
• Assist with or create functional specifications to convey end user requirements to the

development staff in the form of user stories * Design and execute test plans, scenarios, and procedures in accordance with the scope of the change or enhancement
• Monitor defect resolution efforts and track successes; detect scope changes and escalate issues as needed

• Manage issues, expectations proactively rather than reactively to ensure best in class business user experience

• Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language

description:
Job title: Business Analyst, Customer Experience

Company: Hilton

Job description: *** The location for this position is virtual/remote ***

Hilton Reservations and Customer Care (HRCC) is on a path to revolutionize human hospitality in a digital world, the same way we defined hospitality from its early beginnings. We strive to deliver personalized solutions that inspire a passion for travel, and our goal is to make a lasting impression with every Hilton guest with whom we interact.

What will I be doing?

Are you looking for an exciting career in a contact center environment, gathering and analyzing data and impacting the business? The Business Analyst directly supports reporting and analysis with a specific focus on performance metrics. You will also help drive strategic decision-making by utilizing various tools and advanced analytical skills to extract, prioritize, and analyze large amounts of data and effectively communicate findings to leadership.

More specifically, you will:

Establish and Maintain Data Integrity
• Understand key data metrics, establish reporting processes, and identify data discrepancies and errors.
• Test and evaluate data accuracy for different datasets.
• Provide local IT team with business requirements and data requirements to support data structure, governance, and integrity.

Understand, Analyze, Communicate and Deliver Data Efficiently
• Use Business Intelligence (BI) tools (MicroStrategy, Alteryx, Tableau, R) and spreadsheets to manipulate data to create and automate reports
• Use BI tools to design and build dashboards with visualizations to show impactful trends, patterns, and relationships.
• Performs analysis, trending, and communications of defined key performance metrics
• Compile executive-level reporting as required and create reports for communication of daily/weekly/monthly contact center performance to leadership
• Ability to sift through large quantities of data and identify trends, areas of opportunity, and issues and communicate as a story
• Conduct Ad Hoc requests for the Workforce Management and Planning teams and contact center operations teams, such as research into issues, process mapping, and any root cause analysis
• Use verbal and written interpersonal skills to deliver concise analytical observations and recommendations to business owners and leadership.
• Participate in decision-making and advise business leaders using data.

What are we looking for?

The success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:
• Expertise with Microsoft Office Suite, with high proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
• Deep understanding of the fundamentals of database structure and relationships.
• An innovative and intellectually curious mind, willing to challenge the status quo to continuously improve.
• An ability to quickly learn and master new tools, programs, or languages, and develop a versatile analytical toolkit.
• A desire to partner across teams and organizational functions with diversity in skills and perspectives to arrive at an effective solution.
• An affinity and passion for data to drive key strategic and tactical decisions.
• The ability to handle various tasks with competing deadlines, able to prioritize, and plan.

To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:
• High School Diploma/GED
• Two (2) years of experience analyzing data, including storytelling and reporting, in a contact center environment
• Experience with BI Tools to create dashboards and data visualization (MicroStrategy, Alteryx, R, Adobe, etc.)
• Knowledge of database structure and extraction of data from data fields and tables
• Experience owning and managing projects

It would be useful in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
• Bachelor’s Degree, or Associate’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, and related plus 3 years' demonstrated ability in data analytics

title: S2P Systems Analyst – Coupa (Jr. to Mid-Level)
description:
S2P Systems Analyst – Coupa

Job Overview:

Stratfield is seeking an S2P Systems Analyst – Coupa to join our Client’s Technology Solutions team. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Coupa and a solid understanding of Source-to-Pay (S2P) processes. This role will focus on system configuration, issue resolution, and continuous improvement across procurement and payables operations.

This is a remote contract position. Sponsorship is not available for this position.

Responsibilities:
• Configure and enhance the Coupa S2P system to support evolving business needs.
• Resolve functional and integration issues within Coupa and related systems (e.g., ERP, master data tools).
• Evaluate Coupa release updates and assess potential impacts or required changes.
• Create and execute test plans for new features, defect fixes, and system updates.
• Collaborate with integration and process teams to ensure seamless cross-platform functionality.
• Drive user adoption through improved usability and effective support.
• Lead solution design for enhancements, new requirements, and issue remediation.
• Apply deep functional knowledge across supplier onboarding, requisitions, sourcing, invoicing, and payments.
• Build strong partnerships with key business stakeholders and regional super users.
• Develop and maintain reports and queries; ensure data accuracy and support decision-making.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, IT, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
• Proven experience with Coupa (required) and familiarity with other S2P platforms (e.g., Ariba, GEP, ERP S2P modules).
• Strong problem-solving skills with a track record of meeting deadlines.
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and reporting tools.
• Excellent attention to detail, communication, and analytical skills.
• Understanding of compliance and governance requirements.
• Preferred: Experience in finance or procurement functions.
• Preferred: Exposure to complex, multi-system environments.

About Stratfield

We started Stratfield Consulting with the belief that companies need a more dependable partner for delivering complex projects. We believe that Better People combined with Better Tools lead to Better Projects. Our goal is to be the most trusted consulting firm for our clients, and we’re selective about who joins our team.

description:
Location: Remote / Flexible

We’re a fast-growing health tech startup looking for a part-time contractor to help create Executive Business Review (EBR) decks for our healthcare clients. This role is ideal for someone who’s confident working with data and enjoys turning numbers into clear, visual stories.

Responsibilities:

Build and update client-facing EBRs using Google Sheets and Tableau

Analyze healthcare performance data and highlight key insights

Collaborate with internal teams to align on metrics and client goals

Ensure visual consistency and data accuracy across deliverables

Qualifications

Strong experience with Google Sheets and Tableau

Comfortable working with raw data to build charts, tables, and visualizations

Clear communicator with a strong eye for detail and design

Experience in healthcare, health tech, or client reporting is a bonus

Details

Up to 5 hours/week

If you enjoy making data meaningful—and visually engaging—we’d love to hear from you. Please submit a brief note with examples of past reporting work.
